text: Wheeler House The William Wheeler House, also known as Wheeler Hall, is a dormitory in Amherst, Massachusetts that is built in the georgian revival style with art deco accents. It is named after former professor of the Massachusetts Agricultural College, William Wheeler. It is part of the Central Residential Area at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. It was designed by Louis Ross, who designed many of the dormitories on campus as well as the Student Union. == References == ==External links== *Official website for Wheeler Hall *Van Meter Hall *Umass Library entry for Wheeler Hall Category:Residential buildings completed in 1958 Category:University of Massachusetts Amherst residence halls
title: William Wheeler House (Amherst, Massachusetts)
